title: Support for running systemd
body: Not to replace the current WSL init, per se, but it would be very useful to be able to run "systemd --system --unit=foo.target" as a way to set up and manage sets of services/daemons required for particular development, etc., configurations.

+1 Having systemd (systemctl, journalctl) working is really essential in being able to run linux services.

Agree with madumlao's comment that the systemctl interface is the most important part of this. Since nearly all the major Linux distros use systemd as the default, a lot of scripts have started relying on the existence of systemctl to start and stop services. Making .service unit files work is almost as important, but systemctl not working is the biggest pain point here.
